result.execSummary:
All charges against Christopher Lamer Williams in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Lamer Williams is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Lamer Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Lamer Williams in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Lamer Williams appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Matter scheduled for Status Conference.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.

Defendant Christopher Lamer Williams in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Also present in Court, LFW.  Court reminded LFW of no contact order currently in place.  Court ordered the defendant to be evaluated by the public defenders office.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with L.F.W.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher Lamer Williams in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Lamer Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom.   Defendant waives In Person appearance; Matter live streamed on Dacast.
Defendant was having technical issues and appears through defense counsel phone. 
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.

Defendant no longer wants to enter into DPA. Case transferred to Branch 30 for pretrial conference. 
Case will be heard in person in 622CH.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
